name: Sumac Grill + Drinks - Middle Eastern Flavors in Reykjavík
description: Sumac brings the nostalgic atmosphere and flavors of Beirut to downtown Reykjavík, offering locals and visitors delicious Middle Eastern cuisine and handcrafted Mediterranean cocktails in a setting that celebrates Lebanese and Moroccan culinary traditions while incorporating exceptional Icelandic ingredients that create unexpected but harmonious flavor combinations. Located at Laugavegur 28 on Reykjavík's main shopping street, the restaurant occupies prime real estate in the city's most trafficked pedestrian area, drawing foot traffic from tourists shopping for Icelandic woolens and locals meeting friends for drinks and dinner. Named after sumac—the tart, lemony spice fundamental to Middle Eastern cooking made from dried and ground red berries of the sumac bush—the restaurant signals its commitment to authentic flavors and traditional spice blends that define Levantine cuisine, though chef Thrainn Freyr Vigfusson creatively integrates Icelandic lamb, seafood, and dairy into Middle Eastern preparations that respect both culinary traditions. The menu showcases Middle Eastern and North African spices and flavors mixed with Icelandic ingredients, creating fusion that never feels forced or gimmicky but instead represents thoughtful exploration of how Iceland's exceptional proteins and vegetables work within established flavor profiles from Moroccan tagines, Lebanese mezze, and pan-Mediterranean grilling traditions. Highlighted dishes include flatbread with za'atar and hummus providing the warm.

opening_hours.cuisine: Middle Eastern (Lebanese & Moroccan) with Icelandic ingredients

opening_hours.mezze_culture: Many small plates with drinks, lingering dining experience
